Bibliographic References: Ex Basel, M u M , Schweizerische KunstNon Sepcified und Antiquitatenmesse, 1983, Stand 145, ill. on p. 7; Schauenburg, RM 90, 1983, p. 347, pi. 84, 1; Sonderliste U (1984), p. 28, no. 43, ill. on p. 29.
Imagery Description: (a) Telephos on the altar, holding the young Orestes, between Agamemnon and Clytemnestra; above, Calchas, Apollo, Hermes and woman (inscribed ΘΡΙΣΑ), (a) Dionysiac scene—below: Dionysos bending forward to 1., between bearded silen and maenad; above: busts of youth, woman, maenad with thyrsus, silen. The identifying inscriptions in added white have now largely disappeared; the signature is painted in black glaze on the first step of the threeNon Sepcifiedstepped base of the altar.
